result.execSummary:
The defendant Domonique S Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/DNA Surcharge to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 6/01/2016 or penalty of 5 days Huber for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Domonique S Cooper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Received May 25, 2016,   Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Daniel Murray
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Domonique S Cooper in court with attorney Daniel P. Murray.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Murray makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
FINE: $379.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 6/1/2016 .  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 5 days in Huber
State's demand for discovery and inspection and notice of intent to use defendant's statement and DNA evidence.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on May 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Domonique S Cooper in court with attorney Daniel P. Murray.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on April 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Order appointing advocate counsel signed by Judge Ramirez.

Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court.   Defendant Domonique S Cooper did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Murray advises he just received a phone call from his client, the defendants car would not start.  Court adjourns this hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 03-28-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Domonique S Cooper in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court appoints Attorney Murray as counsel in this matter.  Court finds may not be indigent, but the court does not feel the defendant is competent to go forward without counsel.  Attorney Murray accepts the appointment of counsel.  Defendant pays $50.00 a month commencing March 15, 2016 for the appointment of counsel.  Attorney Murray to draft an order regarding the appointment of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Domonique S Cooper in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to plea today, court gives the defendant documents to fill out.
Hearing at 02-26-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Domonique S Cooper in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court previously found that the defendant is not indigent and not eligible for an appointment of counsel.  Defendant to contact the DA for a pretrial offer.  Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
DENIED by Judge Ramirez on 01-04-16
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing at 02-05-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Domonique S Cooper in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  There is no offer by the State at this time.  Court adjourns this matter to speak with the DA.  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 01-04-2016 10:00 am
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Domonique S Cooper in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant was provided petition for appointment of counsel papers in court.  Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
